data.name: plSellType.Help
data.value:
Choose action after user order products which belong this department. Note, you can't change this value after add department. Value can be one of the following:
0 Physical Goods - shipping user with specific physical goods, choose this item if you want to sell normal product online.
1 Software/Digital Files - give user rights to download specific files, choose this item if you want to sell software (or digital files) online.
2 Portal Roles - add user to a specific role, choose this item if you want charge money based site roles. You can also offer download files for this role. User can view these download files before their role expired. You can use this department as file subscriber or something similar.
3 Others - Other services which don't handle on this site. For example, if you sell virtual goods (like online game account).

data.name: plDetailPage.Help
data.value: Select which page to dispaly product detail which belong to this department. You should put a Cp_Product_Detail sub module instance on that page and select its department to this item. Note, module will automatic fill this value when you put Cp_Product_Detail sub module instance on page first time.

data.name: plEnableTax.Help
data.value: Check this option to charge tax based product price. For example, if product price is $100 and tax rate is 1.00, then user need to pay $101 to get it.

data.name: plImage.Help
data.value: Specify a image for this department (optional)

data.name: plListPage.Help
data.value: Select which page to dispaly product list which belong to this department when user search product or click product category. You should put a Cp_Product_List sub module instance on that page and select its department to this item. Note, module will automatic fill this value when you put Cp_Product_List sub module instance on page first time.

data.name: plTaxRate.Help
data.value: Specify tax rete for this department of product. For example, if product price is $100 and tax rate is 1.00, then user need to pay $101 to get it.

data.name: plChargePercent.Help
data.value: Enter a percent which will charge from sellers. For example, if enter 30, then when a seller sell $100, he will keep $70 and site will get $30.

data.name: imgTax.Text
data.value: View/Edit tax rate for this department

data.name: lblTaxList.Text
data.value: Tax rate list for "{0}". Note: 1. Tax charges based client billing country and state. 2. Each product can specify a fixed tax rate to overide these rules.

data.name: plCountry.Help
data.value: Select country which you want to add tax rate

data.name: plEnableField.Help
data.value:
Specifications are detail description of products which belong to this department. Module has some built-in fields, like "Description/After Service/Special Offer" for all departments. And it also supports "Delivery" property for physical goods and "License" for software/digital files.
Besides that, module also support up 5 additional specification fields which you can customize. You can enable them and specify their title and default value.
For example, if you sell notebook, besides "Detail Description", you may want add "Technical Details" specification for it (check http://www.amazon.com/Toshiba-Satellite-L645D-S4036-TruBrite-14-Inch/dp/B003M5GVJY/ref=sr_1_2?m=ATVPDKIKX0DER&s=pc&ie=UTF8&qid=1285333024&sr=1-2 for live demo).
Note, use these specification fields for long content (html or text based ). If you want to customize short specific content, use "Product Attributes" feature in CP_Admin sub module instead.

data.name: plFieldTitle.Help
data.value: Enter title for this specification, like "Technical Details"

data.name: plState.Help
data.value: Select state which you want to add tax rate, select "All State (*)" to applied to all states.

data.name: Tip_FieldEnable.Text
data.value:
Module has some built-in fields for product information. Like "Summary/Support/Sku/Weight/Image.......". You can control whether to use them for each deparment. For example, if you uncheck "Enable Sku Field" option for current department, then when post products which belong to this deparment, the "Sku" field will be hidden. It also will be hidden when display in Cp_Product_List and Cp_Product_Detail sub modules.

  Note, some fields will be hidden automatically for specific department. For example, if current department sell type is "Digital files", then the "Weight" will be hidden automatically.

data.name: plRequireAddress.Help
data.value: Check this option to require client enter their address information while ordering products which belong to current department. Note, if "sell property" of current department is "physical goods", then module will require client enter their address information even this option is unchecked.

data.name: lblFieldDefault.Text
data.value: Default value for this specification. Seller can modify it to fit his/her products.

data.name: Tip_ChargePercent.Text
data.value: Enter a percent (0 - 100) which will charge from seller sales. For example, if enter 30, then when a seller sell $100, he will get $70 and site will keep $30. Check "Cp_Admin sub module - Help - How to charge commision from seller sales?" and also "How to sell portal roles (seller roles)" section for more details.

data.name: Tip_DetailPage.Text
data.value:
Select which page to dispaly product detail which belong to this department. You should put a Cp_Product_Detail sub module instance on that page and select its department to this item.

   Note, module will automatic fill this value when you put Cp_Product_Detail sub module instance on page first time. You can also click "Run detail page setting wizard" button to configure it at any time.

  This setting is also vital to integrate with DNN built-in search mechanism. If you can't search your products with DNN built-in search, please check this setting.

data.name: Tip_EnableTax.Text
data.value: Check this option to charge tax based product price. For example, if product price is $100 and tax rate is 1.00, then user needs to pay $101 to get it.

data.name: Tip_ExtendField.Text
data.value:
Specifications are detail description of products which belong to this department. Module already has a built-in fields - "Detail" for all departments.

  Besides that, module also supports up 5 additional specification fields which you can customize. You can enable them and specify their title and default value.

   For example, if you publish notebook products, besides "Product Detail", you may also want add a "Technical Detail" specification for it. To do it, you can check on "Enable" option for "Specification 1", input "Technical Detail" as its title. Then seller will see a "Technical Detail" field while editing products which belong to current department. You can also specify "Default value" for it so seller can simply modify this default value while editing his products.

  Note, use these specification fields for long content (html based ). If you want to customize short specific content, use "Cp_Admin sub module - Admin Control Panel - System Data - Attributes" feature instead.

data.name: Tip_ListPage.Text
data.value: Select which page to dispaly product list which belong to this department when user search product or click product category. You should put a Cp_Product_List sub module instance on that page and select its department to this item. Note, module will automatic fill this value when you put Cp_Product_List sub module instance on page first time.

data.name: Tip_RequireAddress.Text
data.value: Check this option to require client enter their address information while ordering products which belong to current department. Note, if "sell property" of current department is "physical goods", then module will require client enter their address information even this option is unchecked.

data.name: Tip_SellType.Text
data.value:
Choose product content which belong this department. Note, you can't change this value after update department. Value can be one of the following:
0 Physical Goods - ship user with specific physical goods, choose this item if you want to sell normal product online.
1 Software/Digital Files - give user rights to download specific files, choose this item if you want to sell software (or digital files, videos, audio) online.
3 Others - Other services which don't handle on this site. For example, if you sell virtual goods (like online game account).

data.name: plAllowGoogleMap.Help
data.value: Check this option to integrate with Google Maps. Products which belong to this department can provide its longitude and latitude and show in Google Maps.

data.name: plAllowRecursiveBill.Help
data.value: If this option is checked, products which belong to this departments can charge recursive. Note, if "sell property" of current department is "Portal Roles", then it will support recursive billing even this option is unchecked.

data.name: Tip_AllowGoogleMap.Text
data.value: Check this option to integrate with Google Maps. Listings which belong to this department can provide its longitude/latitude and show in Google Maps. This is useful when you publish map related listings (e.g. park, city, hotel...etc).

data.name: Tip_AllowRecursiveBill.Text
data.value: If this option is checked, products which belong to this departments can charge recursive. Note, you must enable "PayPal" payment gateway to charge recursive.

data.name: li_ActionType_Second_item.Text
data.value: Second item (supports more than 1 identical product)

data.name: plAllowProxyBidding.Help
data.value: Check on "Enable Proxy Bidding" option to let module automatic bidding for customer based his desired price, read the "Proxy Bidding" explanation below for more details.

data.name: plAuctionType.Help
data.value: Note, the "Auction Type" <font color="red">can't be changed</font> after updated, please read the "Auction Type" explanation below before select this value.

data.name: plMaxAuctionDays.Help
data.value: Enter the maximum days before auction expire. Seller can only enter a lower days than this value for his auction products.

data.name: Tip_Auction.Text
data.value: The "Auction Type" <font color="red">can't be changed</font> after update, please click the "Auction Type Explanation" tab for more details before select this value.

data.name: Tip_AuctionType.Text
data.value:
Module supports 4 types of auctions, as follows:

  1. English Auction, also known as an open ascending price auction. This type of auction is arguably the most common form of auction in use today. Participants bid openly against one another, with each subsequent bid higher than the previous bid. The auction ends when no participant is willing to bid further, at which point the highest bidder pays their bid. Alternatively, if the seller has set a minimum sale price in advance (the 'reserve' price) and the final bid does not reach that price the item remains unsold. Sometimes the auctioneer sets a minimum amount by which the next bid must exceed the current highest bid.

  The most significant distinguishing factor of this auction type is that the current highest bid is always available to potential bidders. The English auction is commonly used for selling goods, most prominently antiques and artwork, but also secondhand goods and real estate.

  2. Sealed first-price auction, also known as a first-price sealed-bid auction (FPSB). In this type of auction all bidders simultaneously submit sealed bids so that no bidder knows the bid of any other participant. The highest bidder pays the price they submitted.

  This type of auction is distinct from the English auction, in that bidders can only submit one bid each. Furthermore, as bidders cannot see the bids of other participants they cannot adjust their own bids accordingly. Sealed first-price auctions are commonly used in tendering, particularly for government contracts and auctions for mining leases.

  3. Vickrey auction, also known as a sealed-bid second-price auction. This is identical to the sealed first-price auction except that the winning bidder pays the second highest bid rather than their own. This is very similar to the proxy bidding system used by eBay, where the winner pays the second highest bid plus a bidding increment (e.g. 10%).

  4. Second item auction is the only one which supports more than 1 quantity of product. In a second item auction, the seller offers more than one identical item for sale, so that there may be more than one winning bidder. Each bidder can bid for all the items or only some of them, and publicly indicates the price that he/she is willing to pay for each item. However, all winning bidders need to pay only the lowest qualifying (successful) bid. If there are more successful bids than items available, priority goes to the bidders who submitted their bids first.

  In order to beat a competing bidder, one must bid a higher price per item than that competitor, regardless of the number of items that are being bid for. Here is an example of how this might work:

  The seller auctions 5 identical items.
  Bidder "A" bids for 2 items at $20 each.
  Bidder "B" bids for 4 items at $21 each.
  Bidder "C" bids for 3 items at $18 each.

  The outcome of this auction would be:
  Bidder "B" wins 4 items at $20 each....
  Bidder "A" wins 1 item at $20 each.

  The price is $20 because that was the lowest successful bid (hence the second price).
  Since Bidder "A" was only awarded 1 item, and his original bid was for 2 items, he has the right to refuse the purchase of that partial amount.
  As a winning bidder, you have the right to refuse paying if you are only awarded less than the number of the items you were bidding on..

data.name: Tip_ProxyBidding.Text
data.value:
Check on "Enable Proxy Bidding" option to let module automatic bidding for customer based his desired price. For example, an auction start price is $10, the minimum increment for each bidding is $5, if user "A" is willing to get this product with up to $80, he can enter 80 as his desired price. When another user (e.g. user "B") enter $40 to bid this product, module will automatic create a bidding for user "A" with $45(40+5) to help user "A" win this product. The proxy bidding will stop when the bidding price exceed user disired price, for example, if user "B" enter $79 to bid product again, module will not create a bidding for user "A" because 84(79 + 5) is bigger than 80.

  Note, the proxy bidding mechanism can only be used with "English" auction type.

data.name: plBidIncrement.Help
data.value: Enter the default minimum increment for each bidding, seller can modify this value according his auction listings.

data.name: Tip_AllowLocation.Text
data.value: If checked, listings which belong to this department can specify its location(country, province, city, and town). This is useful when you publish location related listings. For example, when publish ads for restaurant, seller can specify a restaurant location to country = USA, state/province = California, city = Los Angeles, town = Bell.

data.name: plAllowUploadForOrder.Help
data.value: Allow client to upload files while ordering products which belong to this department.

data.name: plAllowUploadForTicket.Help
data.value: Allow client to upload files while submiting help ticket to products which belong to this department.

data.name: plUploadExtension.Help
data.value: Enter the file extension which user can upload. For example, enter "zip,jpg,png", then client can only upload winzip files (.zip) and pictures (.jpg .png).

data.name: plUploadLimit.Help
data.value: How many files user can upload

data.name: plUploadSize.Help
data.value: Specify the file size which user can upload

data.name: Tip_FileUpload.Text
data.value:
You can allow client to upload files while ordering a product (suppose client wins the auction) which belong to this auction department (or submit help ticket) here. For example, you are auctioning the picture printing service, a client can paid for this service, and upload related pictures to you, then you print them and send back to the cilent.

By default, module allows client uploading unlimited files for a order (or for a help ticket), you can limit the total file size and the file extension. For example, if you enter "Upload Limit" as 10, and "File Extension" as "zip,jpg,png", then client can upload up to 10mb files for a order (or for a help ticket), and can only upload winzip files (.zip) and pictures (.jpg .png). Note, the "File Extension" must also exist in DNN Persona Bar "Settings - Security - More - More Security Settings - Allowable File Extensions". For example, if you enter ".psd" at "File Extennsion" to allow client uploading photoshop files (.psd) here, but if .psd doesn't exist in "Allowable File Extensions", then client still can't upload .psd files.

You can also specify the upload file count and extension (size). For example, you can select "Upload File Count" as 2 to allow client uploading 2 files only. And for file 1, enter "File Title" as "Resume", "File Extension" as "doc,docx", "File Size" as "5", then client knows that he needs to upload a MS Word resume (doc, docx), and its size is less than 5mb. For file 2, enter "File Title" as "Personal Photo", "File Extension" as "jpg,png,bmp,jpe,jpeg", "File Size" as "3", then client knows that he needs to upload 1 personal picture.

data.name: plAllowUploadForOrder_Vendor.Help
data.value: Allow Seller Upload files For Order

data.name: plAllowUploadForTicket_Vendor.Help
data.value: Allow seller upload files For help ticket

data.name: plUploadSize_Vendor.Help
data.value: The total file size which seller can upload for a order (or a help ticket).

data.name: Tip_FileUpload_Vendor.Text
data.value:
Besides client, you can also allow seller to upload files for order (or help ticket) which belongs to this department here. For example, you are auctioning the picture processing service, a client can paid for this service, and upload related pictures to you, then you modfiy these files and upload back to the cilent.

You can limit the total file size which seller can upload for a order (a help ticket). But unlike the client file upload, module allows seller uploading unlimited files for a order (or for a help ticket), and doesn't limit the file extension. Of course, the upload file extension must exist in DNN Persona Bar "Settings - Security - More - More Security Settings - Allowable File Extensions"

data.name: plVendorProfilePage.Help
data.value: Choose the Cp_Product_VendorProfile sub module page for this department.

data.name: Tip_VendorProfilePage.Text
data.value:
Select which page to dispaly vendor profile (and his auctions) which belong to this department when user click vendor item at Cp_Product_Vendor sub module. You should put a Cp_Product_VendorProfile sub module instance on that page and select its department to this item. Note, module will automatic fill this value when you put Cp_Product_VendorProfile sub module instance on page first time.

If you have a lot of vendors/sellers who have posted auctions on this site, then the Cp_Product_VendorProfile sub module maybe useful. If not, just ignore it (and the Vendor Profile page option).
